# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import plotly.express as px
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import plotly.offline as py
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All"

source.d09dbcec:
df = pd.read_csv('../input/ballon-dor-nominees/Ballon Dor - Sheet1.csv', encoding='utf8')
pd.set_option('display.max_columns', None)
df.head()
source.d0b14cc0:
#Code by Olga Belitskaya https://www.kaggle.com/olgabelitskaya/parts-of-speech
plt.figure(figsize=(10,5))
sns.countplot(y="Position",data=df,
             facecolor=(0,0,0,0),linewidth=5,
             edgecolor=sns.color_palette("cividis"))
plt.title('Ballon D or Players Positions',
         fontsize=15);
source.ff611666:
##Code by Taha07  https://www.kaggle.com/taha07/data-scientists-jobs-analysis-visualization/notebook

from wordcloud import WordCloud
from wordcloud import STOPWORDS
stopwords = set(STOPWORDS)
wordcloud = WordCloud(background_color = 'yellow',
                      height =2000,
                      width = 2000
                     ).generate(str(df["Player"]))
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (12,12)
plt.axis("off")
plt.imshow(wordcloud)
plt.title("Ballon D'or Nominee Players")
plt.show()

source.688e5266:
#Golden Ball


"The Ballon d'Or is an annual football award presented by French news magazine France Football that is generally regarded as the most prestigious individual award for football players."

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ballon_d%27Or#:~:text=The%20Ballon%20d%27Or%20
